page.title: 01ST. MICHAEL'S MOUNT
page.content:
St. Michael's Mount dominates the village of Marazion and Mount's Bay. At high tide it is an island cut off from the mainland but it is possible to walk across from Marazion at low water by a granite causeway.
A harbour and cottages are situated on the side of the Mount facing the mainland. A path climbs steeply up the hillside to the castle at the top. The castle is the home of Lord and Lady St. Levan. It is a National Trust property and parts of it are open to the public. From the castle there are wide views across Mount's Bay.
